title: Free Study Materials & Books Website for Engineering Students

requirements.text: Create a public, mobile-friendly website that lets engineering college students browse and access free study materials and books organized by academic structure (e.g., department/branch, semester, subject).

quotes: i want  to create the wibsite for the students of engineering colleges for the study matetirials and book of all subject this helps the student to study without cost

acceptanceCriteria: A visitor can navigate from Home to a browsing experience organized by Department/Branch -> Semester -> Subject.
Each Subject page shows a list of available resources (study materials/books) with title, type, and a way to open/download the resource.
The site is usable on mobile and desktop (responsive layout).
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement a searchable and filterable resource catalog UI so students can quickly find materials by keyword and filter by department/semester/subject/resource type.

quotes: for the study matetirials and book of all subject

acceptanceCriteria: A search input filters resources by title (and/or description) without page reload.
Filters exist for at least: Department/Branch, Semester, Subject, and Resource Type (e.g., Notes, Book, Previous Papers, Slides, Lab Manual).
Empty states are handled (e.g., no results found message).

requirements.text: Add a backend data model and API for managing the study resources catalog (departments/semesters/subjects/resources) so the frontend can list and query resources.

quotes: create the wibsite ... for the study matetirials and book of all subject

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods to fetch: list of departments, semesters for a department, subjects for a semester, and resources for a subject.
Resources include at minimum: id, title, resourceType, department, semester, subject, and a URL (or reference) to access the material.
Data persists across canister upgrades using stable storage patterns appropriate for a single-actor Motoko canister.

requirements.text: Provide a simple admin-only management interface to add, edit, and remove resource entries, while keeping reading/downloading public (no login required for students). Use Internet Identity for admin authentication.

quotes: this helps the student to study without cost

acceptanceCriteria: Public users can browse and open resource links without signing in.
An Admin page exists where an authenticated admin can create/update/delete departments/subjects/resources (at least resources).
Only authenticated admins can perform mutations; unauthorized calls are rejected by the backend.
Admin UI includes basic form validation (required fields, valid URL).

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme across the site (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for an academic resource library. Do not use a blue+purple primary palette.

quotes: create the wibsite ... for the students of engineering colleges

acceptanceCriteria: Home, browse pages, subject/resource lists, and admin forms share consistent typography, spacing, and component styles.
The primary color palette is not blue+purple.
Navigation is clear (header with sections like Browse, Search, Admin (if signed in)).

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets (logo and a hero illustration) under frontend/public/assets/generated and display them on the Home page and site header.
acceptanceCriteria: The specified generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The header uses the logo image.
The Home page displays the hero illustration and a short English description of the siteâ€™s purpose.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not modify any frontend files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose existing components instead).
No external databases or third-party auth providers; Internet Identity only for sign-in.
All user-facing text must be in English.
nonGoals: Hosting or storing large PDF/book files inside the canister (use links/URLs to materials instead).
Paid features, subscriptions, or payment processing.
Real-time chat, notifications, or social features.

required: Minimal academic logo with book + gear motif, flat vector style (studyhub-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Engineering students studying with books and laptop, warm neutral palette, flat illustration (studyhub-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
